content.description: Route is rhythmic and consistent. It has the appearance of a ladder and is one of the easiest of the Buttered Logs routes.
Two crucial cross-steps to a slopey side-pull.
content.protection: A crash pad would be nice, but not necessary to top!

content.description: Climb up the face using moderate crimps. See photo for start holds. BOTH ARETES ARE OFF
content.location: South sentinal, east face. Face to the right of The 5th Element.  See photo for start holds Both aretes are off including the cut-out lower right portion

content.description: Start at the bottom of the left flake and a side pull on the left side. Use the flake and heel or toehooks to work your way to the top. Left arete is off
content.location: eastmost sentinal to the right side of washboard abs

content.description: crux probably toward the top, have to smear with your right foot to top out.
content.location: flip side of "washboard abs" at Milwaukee Lakefront pillars

content.description: Climb the arete using the crimps on the right face and compressing the left face. Get a high foot on the arete and shoot for the crimp beneath the polished dish. The flake on the left face next to the arete is off.
content.location: East sentinal, northwest face. The arete between Deathstar and Tootmaster McGee.

content.description: Start with a right hand on the flake, the left on the arete, and some good feet on the left face. Climb up the arete using any features on the flake or either face. Both aretes marked in red are off.
content.location: North sentinal, southeast face. Located on the arete between frosted flake and two-step

content.description: Start with left hand at the bottom of the left flake and right hand compressed on the slopey pinch next to the arete. Move up using the left flake and a right hand incut sidepull until you get to a diagonal ledge and a right crimp in the face at the top. Both aretes are OFF. A bit subjective where the right arete so refer to the photo for clarification.
content.location: East sentinal, North face. Located on the face of Tootmaster McGee

content.description: Compress using sidepulls and smearing feet to work up the face. Easy once u hit the jug
content.location: South sentinal. Face to the left of Ball Bearing

content.description: Start on the right crimp on the face and a sidepull on the left
content.location: To the left of One Good Feet

climbs.name: I Can't Believe it's Not Buttered Logs

content.description: Don't forget to traverse the Buttered Log. Watch out for cops.
content.protection: A crash pad would be nice but is not necessary.

content.description: Start with both hands compressed beneath the flake. Use good feet on both aretes to work to the top
Start on either side and compress to the top. Be careful because the edge above the polished dish at the top is sharp
content.location: Opposite face of Washboard Abs. East sentinal

content.description: Its going to be all sidepulls until you get on the "arrow". Trust your feet placement as you go up. The arrow is a super nice hold. Reach up to a nice crimp and heel hook to top out.
content.location: Left side of put your fingers in gabby

content.description:
An arete focused boulder with limited foot-holds on the face. 

This route is on the same block as Washboard Abs (to the left of it).
content.location: At the corner of Lake Drive and McKinley Marina - Milwaukee, Wisconsin

climbs.name: Between a Rock and a Hard Place

content.description: First off, you have to be tall for this one. You start pressed between the south and east Sentinels. Topping out is pretty sketch, so be careful and don't die.
content.location: Between the south and east Sentinels.

content.description:
Start with a right hand on the arete and a left hand on the crimp on the face (shown in photo). Climb up the arete using the right sidepull and crimps on the face until you get to the top where a right side-pull can be used on the right face to top out.

 Both adjacent aretes are off
content.location: East sentinal, Southwest arete. On the arete between Deathstar and Chicken Little

content.description: Start compressed on both sides and work your way up using sidepulls and some crimp rails
content.location: Southmost sentinal. The face with the ball engraved in it.

content.description: Start with a left hand side-pull on the arete and a right hand 2 finger undercling on the right face. Work up the arete until you get to the incut crimps on the arete, at which point it’s in the bag. Avoid using either adjacent aretes as well as the cutout ledges towards the top of the left face
content.location: South sentinal, northwest arete. See photo for startholds

content.description: This is the boulder problem on the adjacent face right of "Washboard Abs" on the northeast face of the northeast pillar. Use flake on left and arete on the right. Reachy, but positively stimulating, moves to a nothing short of exhilarating top out with a view of the Earth Day celebration and Rugby or Cricket games.
There exists three granite pillars which have 4 faces each, making 12 bouldering problems a possibility!
